ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: From this course, I understand atmospheric and ocean dynamics far better than I did before. It was also good to revisit a few concepts from other courses such as asymptotic analysis, boundary layer solution matching etc., but in the context of GFD, rather than a "purely theoretical" course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a really excellent course. Everything was always very clearly explained, and every concept was highly relevant. The term project was a lot of fun too. It's a shame it wasn't longer! I honestly can't think of a weakness - personally, I would have been happy with more questions on the problem sets, but this is a really minor thing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. It can be mathematically challenging at times, but it's worth it.
